item.title: Countdown at bus shelter 0123 0049 at bus stop H Burnt Ash Road / Lee Road towards Blackheath Or Lewisham : display is hung and no longer scrolls, 10th October
item.description:
Countdown at bus shelter 0123 0049 at bus stop H Burnt Ash Road / Lee Road towards Blackheath Or Lewisham : display is hung and no longer scrolls See display photos as attached - display hung like this since yesterday Thank you

item.title: ?Asbestos toilet cistern -looks like has been dumped by alley, 10th October
item.description:
I was walking home from work and saw something dumped in a black bin-liner next to the alley between Granby Road and Grangehill Road. I didnâ€™t have a good look, but I think it is an asbestos toilet cistern.

item.title: Telephone boxes filled with rubbish potential fire hazard, 10th October
item.description:
The unused and neglected telephone boxes along Greenwich High Road before joining Greenwich Church Street have become a dumping place. Its a potential fire risk if cigarettes or vapes are thrown in. Could also be targeted by arsonists.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roan Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent: Rubbish still here, 10th October
item.description:
Rubbish that has remained on the stairs for the past two weeks. This ongoing issue is not only unsightly but also poses a significant health and safety risk. The obstruction makes it difficultâ€”and potentially hazardousâ€”for residents to use the stairs in both directions. Given the duration of the problem and the potential for accidents or hygiene concerns, I kindly request that the rubbish be removed as a matter of urgency. It is important that steps are taken to ensure the stairway remains clean, safe, and accessible for all residents going forward. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmdene Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
